sentences.en: By a curious twist of fate, cricket was also my favourite sport.
sentences.cn: 让人感到惊奇的是，板球碰巧也是我最喜欢的运动。

sentences.en: By a strange quirk of fate they had booked into the same hotel.
sentences.cn: 真是天缘奇遇，他们住进了同一家旅馆。

sentences.en: By some freak of fate, she won an enormous sum of money.
sentences.cn: 她不知交了什么好运, 赢了一大笔钱.

sentences.en: Custer was an idiot and a brute and he deserved his fate.
sentences.cn: 卡斯特是个白痴，是个残暴的家伙，他罪有应得。
有时命运的捉弄很残酷。
她与他的命运纠缠在一起。

sentences.en: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.cn: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

sentences.en: Sir John Smith baronet abandoned his son to his fate.
sentences.cn: 约翰·史密斯爵士遗弃了儿子,任其受命运摆布.

sentences.en: The Casino, where she had often danced, had suffered a similar fate.
sentences.cn: 她经常跳舞的赌场遭遇了相似的命运。

sentences.en: The fate line begins close to the wrist.
sentences.cn: 命运线始于接近手腕的地方。

sentences.en: The fate of the three men is unknown.
The former manager of the company repined against his cruel fate.
sentences.cn: 公司前经理怨叹命运对他太残酷.

sentences.en: Their fate is still in the melting pot.
sentences.cn: 他们的命运仍然难以预料。

sentences.en: They held his fate in the palms of their ancient hands.
sentences.cn: 他们这些老人将他的命运掌握在手心里。

sentences.en: They were unaware of the fate that was to befall them.
sentences.cn: 他们并不知道即将降临到他们头上的厄运。

sentences.en: Your future is bound up with the fate of your motherland.
sentences.cn: 你的前途同祖国的命运紧密相联.

words.tran_cn: 致命的；重大的；毁灭性的；命中注定的
命中注定的，宿命的；受命运支配的
重大的；决定性的；宿命的
致命地；命中注定地；不可避免地
死亡；宿命；致命性；不幸；灾祸

phrases.tran_cn: 使注定遭殃，使无法逃避不快之事

trans.tran_en: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period
